TopicTitle: What would cause this Kraken bug?

Articles.Content:
Trying to set up a mining operation on the Mun. Landed a couple of unmanned ships. When I went to re-visit them, this is what happened:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pBjg5WpWcUo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

You'll notice everything is fine at first, then the solar panels start to oscillate for some reason...

It sort of resembles the kraken that you can get with MKS kontainers.

What are you using for the central support beam? I can't really tell.

I'll stand corrected but it seems that KSP/Unity real number calculations use maximum significant digits instead of reducing the number of digits.

There's a way of doing calculations, that prevent 'run-away' numbers.. which is probably what you're seeing.

![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

This has been happening on one of my designs too. I have Gigantor XL solar panels surface-attached to the longest I-beams (M-beam 200 I-beam) stacked in a series. Without SAS or anything turned on, the I-beams will start to build up a rotational wobble, like they're twisting back and forth like a washing machine. This causes the solar panels to wobble on them, and as the shimmy builds it will eventually cause the solar panels to break off violently.

![screenshot8_zpsfvemb3gf.png](http://i1356.photobucket.com/albums/q737/raptor_9000/Placeholder%20Photos/screenshot8_zpsfvemb3gf.png)

I have the solar panel arms mounted with OKTO probe cores and RCS thrusters on the small docking ports so I can undock and reposition the solar arrays directly into the sun. When I undock the solar "arms", the shimmy will go away if I momentarily tap time warp. As soon as I reattach, the shimmy will begin to build eventually.

> 
> Trying to set up a mining operation on the Mun. Landed a couple of unmanned ships. When I went to re-visit them, this is what happened:
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pBjg5WpWcUo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> You'll notice everything is fine at first, then the solar panels start to oscillate for some reason...

Are any parts clipped into other parts?

Edit: And I would also verify the ship does not span two Mun surface tiles.
